29th May 2021, updated on 28/4/2024: Laporan Pilihanraya Umum Malaysia 1986, Suruhanjaya Pilihanraya Malaysia (EC), Government Gazetter 31/7/1986, New Straits Times 5 August 1986, Tindak Malaysia Github. For specific Parliamentarian Candidate background details, refer to 1986_Other_Sources_Parliament_File

EC produced conflicting values of total electorate for contested constituencies (6791446), total ballot issued (4752006), total rejected votes (126734) and total valid votes (4625272). EC undercounted total votes of NASMA (10360). New Straits Times 5 August 1986 claims there were only four SNAP and five PBDS candidates. New Straits Times 2 August 1986 states that there are five SNAP candidates. Star 10 August 1986 states there are two HAMIM candidates while New Straits Times 5 August 1986 states there is only one HAMIM candidate. EC had a contradictory value of 55416 as total electorate for Batu Pahat. EC placed a contradictory value of total electorate of contested constituencies in Johor (767930). EC missed out placing Lost deposit status for PAS candidate (Pontian). Sex category for Chinese candidates are largely backed up with evidences but caution must be exercised due to certain data limitations. Constituency Spelling follows the 1984 Peninsular Malaysia Redelineation Report, 1984 Sabah Redelineation Report and 1977 Sarawak Redelineation Report. Postal Vote Statistics is derived from Laporan Pilihanraya Umum Malaysia 1986, Suruhanjaya Pilihanraya Malaysia. TindakMalaysia Network Services PLT is not responsible for any errors or ommissions arising from the original data or its derivatives
